template.name: Template OS FreeBSD active
template.description: OS template for monitoring FreeBSD systems.

item.name: Maximum number of opened files
item.description: The maximum number of opened files supported/allowed by the kernel.

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: The maximum number of processes supported/allowed by the kernel.

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: The number of processes in running state.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: The total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Host boot time
item.description: The system's boot time.

item.name: Interrupts per second
item.description: Device interrupts per second.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
item.description: The processor 1 minute average load is calculated as system CPU load divided by the number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (5 min average per core)
item.description: The processor 5 minute average load is calculated as system CPU load divided by the number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15 min average per core)
item.description: The processor 15 minute average load is calculated as system CPU load divided by the number of CPU cores.

item.name: Context switches per second
item.description: CPU context switches per second.

item.name: CPU $2 time ($3)
item.description: CPU 5 minute average nice time (the time the CPU has spent doing nothing).

item.name: CPU $2 time ($3)
item.description: CPU 5 minute average interrupt time (the amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts).

item.name: CPU $2 time ($3)
item.description: CPU 5 minute average nice time (the time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced).

item.name: CPU $2 time ($3)
item.description: CPU 5 minute average system time (the time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes).

item.name: CPU $2 time ($3)
item.description: CPU user time (the time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced).

item.name: Host name
item.description: The system's host name.

item.name: Host local time
item.description: The system's local time.

item.name: Free swap space
item.description: The free swap space in bytes.

item.name: Free swap space in %
item.description: The free swap space in percent.

item.name: Total swap space
item.description: The total swap space in bytes.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by `uname -a`

item.name: System uptime
item.description: The system's uptime in seconds.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Overall block device read
item.description: Overall block device read statistics in bytes per seconds.

item.name: Overall block device write
item.description: Overall block device write statistics in bytes per seconds.

item.name: Checksum of $1
item.description: The current checksum of the `/etc/passwd`file.

item.name: Available memory
item.description: The available memory in bytes (inactive + cached + free memory).

item.name: Buffered memory
item.description: The buffered memory in bytes (cache for things like file system metadata).

item.name: Cached memory
item.description: The cached memory in bytes (cache for various things),

item.name: Free memory
item.description: The free memory in bytes (memory that is readily available to any entity requesting memory).

item.name: Available memory in %
item.description: The available memory in percent (inactive + cached + free memory).

item.name: Total memory
item.description: The total memory in bytes.

item.name: Unsupported items
item.description: The number of unsupported items on this host

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

item_prototype.name: Incoming $2 packets on $1
item_prototype.description: The number of incoming dropped packages per second on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Incoming $2 on $1
item_prototype.description: The number of incoming errors per second on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Incoming $2 on $1
item_prototype.description: The number of incoming packages per second on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Incoming network traffic on $1
item_prototype.description: The incoming traffic in bits per second on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing $2 on $1
item_prototype.description: The number of outgoing errors per second on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing $2 on $1
item_prototype.description: The number of outgoing packages per second on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing network traffic on $1
item_prototype.description: The outgoing traffic in bits per second on the network interface.

trigger_prototype.name: Incoming network usage on {HOST.NAME}:{#IFNAME} is high ( > $1/s over {$OS_FREEBSD_NET_IN_BANDWIDTH_WARNING_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"})
trigger_prototype.description: The incoming network usage is above `{$OS_FREEBSD_NET_IN_BANDWIDTH_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#IFNAME}"}` for the last `{$OS_FREEBSD_NET_IN_BANDWIDTH_WARNING_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"}`

dependency.name: Incoming network usage on {HOST.NAME}:{#IFNAME} is very high ( > $1/s over {$OS_FREEBSD_NET_IN_BANDWIDTH_HIGH_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"})

trigger_prototype.name: Incoming network usage on {HOST.NAME}:{#IFNAME} is very high ( > $1/s over {$OS_FREEBSD_NET_IN_BANDWIDTH_HIGH_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"})
trigger_prototype.description: The incoming network usage is above `{$OS_FREEBSD_NET_IN_BANDWIDTH_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#IFNAME}"}` for the last `{$OS_FREEBSD_NET_IN_BANDWIDTH_HIGH_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"}`

trigger_prototype.name: Outgoing network usage on {HOST.NAME}:{#IFNAME} is high ( > $1/s over {$OS_FREEBSD_NET_OUT_BANDWIDTH_WARNING_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"})
trigger_prototype.description: The outgoing network usage is above `{$OS_FREEBSD_NET_OUT_BANDWIDTH_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#IFNAME}"}` for the last `{$OS_FREEBSD_NET_OUT_BANDWIDTH_WARNING_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"})`

dependency.name: Outgoing network usage on {HOST.NAME}:{#IFNAME} is very high ( > $1/s over {$OS_FREEBSD_NET_OUT_BANDWIDTH_HIGH_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"})

trigger_prototype.name: Outgoing network usage on {HOST.NAME}:{#IFNAME} is very high ( > $1/s over {$OS_FREEBSD_NET_OUT_BANDWIDTH_HIGH_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"})
trigger_prototype.description: The outgoing network usage is above `{$OS_FREEBSD_NET_OUT_BANDWIDTH_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#IFNAME}"}` for the last `{$OS_FREEBSD_NET_OUT_BANDWIDTH_HIGH_TIME:"{#IFNAME}"})`

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

item_prototype.name: Free inodes on $1 in %
item_prototype.description: Free inodes in percent on the filesystem.

item_prototype.name: Used inodes on $1 in %
item_prototype.description: Used inodes in percent on the filesystem.

item_prototype.name: Free disk space on $1
item_prototype.description: Free disk space in bytes on the filesystem.

item_prototype.name: Free disk space on $1 in %
item_prototype.description: Free disk space in percent on the filesystem.

item_prototype.name: Used disk space on $1 in %
item_prototype.description: Used disk space in percent on the filesystem.

item_prototype.name: Total disk space on $1
item_prototype.description: Total disk space in bytes of the filesystem.

item_prototype.name: Used disk space on $1
item_prototype.description: Used disk space in bytes on the filesystem.

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space on {HOST.NAME}:{#FSNAME} is low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)
trigger_prototype.description: The free disk space on the filesystem is below `{$OS_FREEBSD_FS_FREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#FSNAME}"}` and `{$OS_FREEBSD_FS_PFREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#FSNAME}"}` percent.

dependency.name: Free disk space on {HOST.NAME}:{#FSNAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space on {HOST.NAME}:{#FSNAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} free)
trigger_prototype.description: The free disk space on the filesystem is below `{$OS_FREEBSD_FS_FREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#FSNAME}"}` and {$OS_FREEBSD_FS_PFREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#FSNAME}"}` percent.

trigger_prototype.name: Free inodes on {HOST.NAME}:{#FSNAME} are low ({ITEM.VALUE1} < $2 % )
trigger_prototype.description: The free inodes on the filesystem are below `{$OS_FREEBSD_INODE_PFREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD:"{#FSNAME}"}`

dependency.name: Free inodes on {HOST.NAME}:{#FSNAME} are very low ({ITEM.VALUE1} < $2 % )

trigger_prototype.name: Free inodes on {HOST.NAME}:{#FSNAME} are very low ({ITEM.VALUE1} < $2 % )
trigger_prototype.description: The free inodes on the filesystem are below `{$OS_FREEBSD_INODE_PFREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD:"{#FSNAME}"}`

resource.name: Overall block device I/O in bytes/s
Overall block device I/O in operations/s

trigger.name: /etc/passwd has been changed on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The `/etc/passwd` has been changed. This could be an indication that someone is trying to tamper with the system or, most likely, just a normal consequence after a user account creation or modification.

trigger.name: Available memory on {HOST.NAME} is low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} available)
trigger.description: The available memory on the system is below `{$OS_FREEBSD_MEMORY_AVAILABLE_WARNING_THRESHOLD}` and `{$OS_FREEBSD_MEMORY_PAVAILABLE_WARNING_THRESHOLD}` percent.

dependency.name: Available memory on {HOST.NAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} bytes available)

trigger.name: Available memory on {HOST.NAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} bytes available)
trigger.description: The available memory on the system is below `{$OS_FREEBSD_MEMORY_AVAILABLE_HIGH_THRESHOLD}` and `{$OS_FREEBSD_MEMORY_PAVAILABLE_HIGH_THRESHOLD}` percent.

trigger.name: Available swap space on {HOST.NAME} is low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} available)
trigger.description: The available swap space on the system is below `{$OS_FREEBSD_SWAP_FREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD}` and `{$OS_FREEBSD_SWAP_PFREE_WARNING_THRESHOLD}` percent.

dependency.name: Available swap space on {HOST.NAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} available)

trigger.name: Available swap space on {HOST.NAME} is very low (< $2 %, {ITEM.VALUE1} available)
trigger.description: The available swap space on the system is below `{$OS_FREEBSD_SWAP_FREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD}` and `{$OS_FREEBSD_SWAP_PFREE_HIGH_THRESHOLD}` percent.

trigger.name: CPU utilization is high (< $1 % idle over {$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_IDLE_WARNING_TIME}) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The CPU is below `{$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_IDLE_WARNING_THRESHOLD}` percent idle over `{$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_IDLE_WARNING_TIME}`.

dependency.name: CPU utilization is very high (< $1 % idle over {$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_IDLE_HIGH_TIME}) on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.name: CPU utilization is very high (< $1 % idle over {$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_IDLE_HIGH_TIME}) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The CPU is below `{$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_IDLE_HIGH_THRESHOLD}` percent idle over `{$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_IDLE_HIGH_TIME}`.

trigger.name: Many processes ({ITEM.VALUE} > $1) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: There are more than `{$OS_FREEBSD_PROC_NUM_WARNING_THRESHOLD}` number of processes on the system.

trigger.name: Processor load is high (> $1 over {$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_LOAD_WARNING_TIME}) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The 1 minute average per core CPU load is over `{$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_LOAD_WARNING_THRESHOLD}` for the last `{$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_LOAD_WARNING_TIME}`

dependency.name: Processor load is very high (> $1 over {$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_LOAD_HIGH_TIME}) on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.name: Processor load is very high (> $1 over {$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_LOAD_HIGH_TIME}) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The 1 minute average per core CPU load is over `{$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_LOAD_HIGH_THRESHOLD}` for the last `{$OS_FREEBSD_CPU_LOAD_HIGH_TIME}`

trigger.name: Time is drifting away on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The system's local time differs for more than `{$OS_FREEBSD_TIME_DRIFT_WARNING_THRESHOLD}` seconds from the Zabbix server.

trigger.name: Too many processes ({ITEM.VALUE} > $1) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: There are more than `{$OS_FREEBSD_PROC_NUM_HIGH_THRESHOLD}` number of processes on the system.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has just been restarted (uptime {ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger.description: The system's uptime is lower than 10 minutes, which indicates a recent start or reboot of the system.

trigger.name: {ITEM.VALUE} unsupported items on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The host has unsupported items, which might be an indication of a problem with certain items. Disable or fix the items.

graph.name: Overall block device I/O in bytes/s
Overall block device I/O in operations/s
